video.title: The Tudors
video.synopsis: All the splendor and scandal of England's 16th-century royal court comes to life in this series that follows notorious Tudor monarch Henry VIII.

episodes.synopsis: Eager for conquest and glory, Henry itches to go to war with France but is instead advised by Cardinal Wolsey to support a course of peace.
episodes.title: In Cold Blood

episodes.synopsis: Though he's pledged loyalty to France, Henry considers -- to Wolsey's objections -- the advantages of allying himself with King Charles V of Spain.
episodes.title: Simply Henry

episodes.synopsis: Henry tries to conceal his marital difficulties from Emperor Charles V, Queen Katherine's nephew. Meanwhile, the beautiful Anne Boleyn charms Henry.
episodes.title: Wolsey, Wolsey, Wolsey!

episodes.synopsis: Henry is declared a "Defender of the Faith" after he denounces Martin Luther, but he's troubled by his wife's inability to produce a legitimate heir.
episodes.title: His Majesty, the King

episodes.synopsis: The political winds shift against Henry when his supposed ally, Charles V, releases the King of France from prison. Henry's passion for Anne grows.
episodes.title: Arise, My Lord

episodes.synopsis: Henry's disillusionment with the Catholic Church grows when it is too slow to enact the annulment of his marriage to Katherine of Aragon.
episodes.title: True Love

episodes.synopsis: England succumbs to an outbreak of the plague and a debilitating food shortage, causing Henry to sink into a depression and doubt his fitness to lead.
episodes.title: Message to the Emperor

episodes.synopsis: Pope Clement finally sends an envoy to deliver judgment on Henry's petition to annul his marriage to Katherine of Aragon on grounds of illegitimacy.
episodes.title: Truth and Justice

episodes.synopsis: Cardinal Wolsey's fortune fails; he is stripped of his title and authority and then banished from the court. Henry replaces him with Sir Thomas More.
episodes.title: Look to God First

episodes.synopsis: Making one last desperate attempt to reverse his fortunes, the downfallen Cardinal Wolsey forges an alliance with his old enemy.
episodes.title: The Death of Wolsey

episodes.synopsis: Not even the pope will stop King Henry VIII from getting his annulment from Katherine and appointing himself the head of the Church of England.
episodes.title: Everything Is Beautiful

episodes.synopsis: Christmas arrives at the Tudor court, where Queen Katherine has been banished and Anne Boleyn's hold on Henry grows ever stronger.
episodes.title: Tears of Blood

episodes.synopsis: Henry, disgusted by the Catholic Church and the difficulty of ending his marriage to Katherine, weds Anne in secret before an annulment is granted.
episodes.title: Checkmate

episodes.synopsis: Henry enacts the Act of Succession, allowing only his and Anne's children as heirs to the throne and proclaiming his supremacy in all matters.
episodes.title: The Act of Succession

episodes.synopsis: Sir Thomas More and Bishop Fisher are imprisoned in the Tower of London for refusing to recognize Henry as the head of the Church of England.
episodes.title: His Majesty's Pleasure

episodes.synopsis: Despite Henry's excommunication by the Catholic Church, the Reformation gathers momentum, as Sir Thomas Cromwell proves a skillful propagandist.
episodes.title: The Definition of Love

episodes.synopsis: Sir Thomas Cromwell's reforms continue unchecked, terrorizing the weakened Catholic Church. Henry is captivated by Sir John Seymour's daughter, Jane.
episodes.title: Matters of State

episodes.synopsis: During a jousting accident, Henry is seriously wounded, leading to talk of his successor. Pregnant Queen Anne is convinced of Henry's infidelity.
episodes.title: Lady in Waiting

episodes.synopsis: Henry is replacing the Boleyns with the Seymours, the new royal favorites. Anne and others are accused of adultery, and all are sentenced to death.
episodes.title: The Act of Treason

episodes.synopsis: Anne is imprisoned, awaiting execution. With Anne and Henry's marriage declared void, Elizabeth is no longer the rightful heir to the throne.
episodes.title: Destiny and Fortune

episodes.synopsis: After Anne Boleyn's beheading, Henry takes a new wife: Jane Seymour. His campaign against Catholicism is met with resistance from his subjects.
episodes.title: Civil Unrest

episodes.synopsis: The Pilgrimage of Grace rebellion begins in earnest, with Henry dispatching Brandon to suppress the uprising. Henry takes a new mistress.
episodes.title: The Northern Uprising

episodes.synopsis: Henry reconciles with daughters Mary and Elizabeth in time for the Christmas holidays, but betrays and brutally suppresses the rebellion against him.
episodes.title: Dissension and Punishment

episodes.synopsis: Henry celebrates the birth of a son, but his joy is short-lived as Queen Jane dies. The leaders of the Pilgrimage of Grace uprising are put to death.
episodes.title: The Death of a Queen

episodes.synopsis: Henry remains in seclusion while mourning the queen's death, an opportunity that enemies of the crown seize to murder several friends of the court.
episodes.title: Problems in the Reformation

episodes.synopsis: Matchmaking begins in earnest as Cromwell schemes to secure Henry a Protestant wife, but the King's marital reputation precedes him across Europe.
episodes.title: Search for a New Queen

episodes.synopsis: With backing from Rome, France and Spain align against England as war looms, so Henry agrees to a politically fortuitous marriage with Anne of Cleves.
episodes.title: Protestant Anne of Cleves

episodes.synopsis: Henry moves swiftly to annul his loveless marriage to Anne of Cleves and beds a new mistress. Cromwell's fall from favor is sudden and dramatic.
episodes.title: The Undoing of Cromwell

episodes.synopsis: Henry is proud of Catherine, his beautiful, vivacious 17-year-old wife, who buys silence from an old friend by making her a member of the court.
episodes.title: Moment of Nostalgia

episodes.synopsis: Joan Bulmer discloses the queen's sexual history to Lady Rochford, who tells it to Culpepper and arranges for him to have a liaison with Catherine.
episodes.title: Sister

episodes.synopsis: While Henry prepares for a politically important trip to meet the defeated Northern rebels, Queen Catherine carries on her affair with Culpepper.
episodes.title: Something for You

episodes.synopsis: Queen Catherine is being blackmailed. Henry receives an anonymous letter accusing his wife of a sexual relationship, and he orders an investigation.
episodes.title: Natural Ally

episodes.synopsis: The investigation into Queen Catherine's past moves quickly. When told of the discoveries, Henry's response is unsentimental and swift.
episodes.title: Bottom of the Pot

episodes.synopsis: The king restores succession rights to his two daughters and dispatches Hertford and his archenemy, the Earl of Surrey, to warn the king of Scotland.
episodes.title: You Have My Permission

episodes.synopsis: Henry marries Catherine Parr. Plans are made for the invasion of France, and Charles Brandon is named commander of the English armies.
episodes.title: Sixth and the Final Wife

episodes.synopsis: More than 2,000 men die of disease and starvation tunneling their way into the French castle at Boulogne. The French surrender to a gloating Henry.
episodes.title: As It Should Be

episodes.synopsis: King Henry VIII is aging rapidly. The arrogant Earl of Surrey endangers Henry's successes in Boulogne, and his rank is withdrawn.
episodes.title: Secrets of the Heart

episodes.synopsis: Henry is forced to surrender Boulogne. Longtime friend King Francis is dying. And as Henry's health begins to fade, thoughts turn toward a successor.
episodes.title: Death of a Monarchy
